result.execSummary:
The defendant Belkasim Moftah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • WIC - Provide Cash for Drafts [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 253.06(4)(a)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence., with 3 days credit.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $641.16 payable to The State of Wisconsin Department of Health Services, $409.25 owed by the defendant alone, $150.91 joint and several with Aldarorah case # 14CF1477.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Request for Return of Passsport signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defense attorney.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Defendant's request to return his passport.
Passport Reinventoried to Room 419 of the Safety Bldg.

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 30 days condition time.  First 10 days Huber for work.  Last 20 days with Huber for work and/or electronic monitoring release.   Court stayed commencement until 01/23/2015 at 5:00pm.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $641.16 payable to The State of Wisconsin Department of Health Services, $409.25 owed by the defendant alone, $150.91 joint and several with Aldarorah case# 14CF1477; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Payment plan as follows: $100/month commencing 03/01/2015 until paid in full.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Restitution Calculations   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing hearing, however defense attorney was not able to get to court before 10am jury trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Counts 1, 2 & 4 are dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to this Court, and with the agreement of all parties, Plea and Sentencing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-29-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and Sentencing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 08-08-2014 at 08:30am.

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-20-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Christopher J Ertl.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Belkasim Moftah in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Belkasim Moftah in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
